repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Kantapurāṇam is one of the major Tamil texts about the god Skanda/Murukaṉ. It is the work of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār (14th century?).
The present manuscript is the third volume of a MVM in four volumes (BnF Indien 324-327).
Paratexts: marginal benedictions; invocation page; marginal chapter headers; in-text chapter completion statement and total stanzas; colophon.

collation.desc: 301 folios = Mūlam. Parallel Tamil foliation 1–301 and Arabic foliation 1–301. Continued from BnF Indien 325.

additions.desc:
A paper leaf comes along with the bundle, with a text in French, in black ink, on the recto:
Mr Ducler, N° 35
Intitulé Scandam, ou Candapouranam, ou histoire de
Soubramaniar, second fils de Sivane,
La guerre avec les geans [i.e. les géants] dit Sourparmas.
Tome troisième
(ouvrage anonyme) Contenant 300 feuilles, In line 1 is added in black pencil: N° 326

origin.origDate: See final colophon of Indien 327 (U2, f163v5).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 80.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
